references: voters' decision in favor of Brexit

justifications: Johnson hailed voters' decision in favor of Brexit.
Johnson said it is time to take back control from a European Union that has become too opaque and not accountable enough to the people it is meant to serve.
Johnson said that the United Kingdom will remain united and European, despite the Brexit vote.
Johnson criticized the United States' stance on Brexit, calling it hypocritical.
Johnson paid tribute to Cameron, calling him "brave" and "one of the most extraordinary politicians of our age."
Johnson criticized President Obama's opposition to Brexit in an essay, calling it incoherent and hypocritical.
Nicholas Soames condemned Johnson's essay as "appalling" and "totally wrong on almost everything."
